nodes.text: Good work in stopping the Dire Rat invasion. The other faculty members were most impressed when the rumors circulated that it was a Rogue who accomplished the task.
I don't know how the rumors got out... I didn't talk to a lot of people about it.

I believe that I might have said a word or two to the others about Rogues handling the situation, although people seemed skeptical of the possibility. I am pleased to know that my confidence in you was not misplaced.
So, Herr O'Conner, who really did stop the Dire Rat invasion - you or your compatriot, Herr Sosi?
I found out that the true cause of the Drat invasion was the Drat Queen. While Sosi may or may not have defeated a Drat nest, he didn't stop the attacks. I did.
Why didn't you speak up when I first asked the question?
I didn't want to seem like I'm bragging about my actions. I thought it would be better to keep things sneaky like a Rogue.
There are times when is is better to speak up and take credit where credit is due. As you see from this situation, there will always be those willing to take credit for anyone else's good deed.
Sosi clearly didn't have any clue about the invasion. He was lying to take credit for it. I'm the one who stopped the Drat Queen.
Then why didn't you speak up when I asked?
I just wanted to see what would happen if I didn't speak up...
Did the result meet with your expectations?
Yes, I thought that Sosi would try to steal the credit.
Perhaps Herr Sosi was trying to show that he is a Rogue?
No, he was just showing that he is a liar... and a bad one.
This is how I stopped the Drat Invasion...
A very interesting tale, Herr O'Conner. I am pleased that you confided the whole story to me.

options.text: Make a Snarky Comment About Sosi

nodes.text: Sosi wouldn't cross the street to help anyone other than himself, let alone go into danger. Alas, he's currently missing a minion or servant here to bully into doing his dirty work.
Why didn't you claim the credit when I inquired upon the incident?
I wanted Sosi to show just what a rat he really is.
There is another matter of which I wished to speak with you - Herr Terk.
Herr Terk has becoming increasingly annoying to both of us. I thought it would be amusing to return the favor.
What do you mean?

Herr Terk has tried to use you as a weapon against me. I request that you instead do me the favor of acting in my stead. I would like you to see if there is anything in Herr Terk's office that could be of use to us.
You want me to break into Terk's office and try to find something suspicious or incriminating?
Precisely. Herr Terk is a methodical person. He will certainly keep records of any dealings he makes. See if you can recover something that can be used against him.
Are you interested in doing this?

nodes.name: Getting the Goods on Terk
nodes.description: Master von Urwald wants me to break into Terk's office to find something to use against Terk. I think of it as revenge - and it will be sweet.

nodes.text: Sure, why not?
You will have to act quickly, the semester is almost done. I will eagerly await your results.
I don't think so...
Very well, we shall speak of this no further.
What is it that you wished to talk about?
Do you have a family, sir?
Many years ago, I had a son about your age. He and I were constantly at odds with one another and I drove him away from me. He died in an unfortunate incident.
Life is a learning experience - and we seldom learn the lessons we wish to learn. Nevertheless, my son taught me a great deal of what it is to be a Rogue.

options.text: Tell About Terk and the Raven

nodes.text: Mr. Terk seems to think that you have the Raven statue...
Indeed?
You don't happen to have it hiding somewhere, do you?
If I did, I certainly wouldn't admit to it.

options.text: Ask About Your Father and Gerhard

nodes.text: I understand that you knew my father - and encouraged him to be a Rogue.
I did, indeed. Your father was an honorable man.
Why didn't you tell me that you knew him? That you knew that he used to be King of the Thieves in all of Sardonia? That my father died because he tried to give up his kingdom?
I do not know how or why your father died, but I am truly sorry that you never got to know the man. He genuinely cared about people and was a true Rogue.

As for why I did not talk to you about your father... you needed to learn some things on your own. Experience is the best teacher, Shawn. It is sometimes cruel and unforgiving, but it does teach important lessons.
What happens when the semester ends?
When the semester ends, you will be free to pursue life as you see fit outside of the university.
Of course, if you do not go out of your way to antagonize me past my endurance over the next few days, you will be welcome to return to this class in the Spring.
I'll see you later, sir.
You will, indeed.
